definitions: To return something to its proper place or storage.
To eat or drink a large amount of something.
To save money, usually for a specific purpose.
To send someone to prison or a mental institution.
To kill an animal, especially one that is old or sick.
examples: Please put away your toys when you're finished playing.
He can really put away a lot of food.
She tries to put away some money each month for retirement.
The judge decided to put him away for ten years.
They had to put the old dog away due to its suffering.
